intro: Phyllorkis ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Phyllorkis ovalifolia is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native region.
